author: Klutch
text: 'Sadly
column5:
COVID forced them out of business.

They were one of the better pizzerias in town. They had big slices at a good price.

There are a lot of superficial people in Hoboken and I think the outside appearance of this business made people overlook it and not spend money there.'

author: j g
text: "Rude and bad customer service. First time and last time customer here. This happened like a year ago
column5: or a year and a half ago
column6: (I know it's a little late review
column7: but why not to share it?) Long story short: when they charge me
column8: (I think it was $8.50) they didn't had coins
column9: so instead of rounding the money down
column10: they round it up to their advantage
column13: they asked me if I have change
column14: but I didn't. I had no time to argue
column15: so I just gave them the $9
column16: and leave. I know that 50 cents its not a big deal (and thats why I didn't argue
column17: plus I was in a rush) but its the action. If I were the owner
column18: I would ask the customer if they have change
column20: then I will charge him 50 cents less; not 50 cents more. What a piece of trash those people are."

author: Brian Pierson
text: 'This place is an eyesore and embarrassment  to the town - from the appearance outside to the quality {lack thereof} inside. It must be able to remain in business for one single reason . . it‚Äôs next to a park. And their core clientele - amped up toddlers - would eat cat food if you called it pizza. Boy
column5: someone really just needs to bulldoze this dilapidated pile of rubbish and start all over. Or maybe
column7: flick a lit cigarette into the grease canisters that line the outside of the building. Rating: 7 Stars / if 1 is the best and 7 is the worst.'

author: Brian Pearson
text: 'Is this place for real ? I thought I was in the middle of a candid-camera episode when I accidentally stumbled into this filthbox. I still say there‚Äôs no way this is a legitimate pizza shop with actual paying customers. The only thing older
column6: and more dilapidated than the outside of this place - is the inside. The pizza is  nearly inedible
column8: the employees are sweaty and miserable . . the most enjoyable part of my ‚Äúmeal‚Äù was the Snapple; which itself wasn‚Äôt very cold in the half-broken fridge. Let‚Äôs be clear: there are literally dozens of pizza places in this town. Maybe there‚Äôs 30 . . in which case 29 would be better than this dumphole. Seriously: why would someone knowingly choose to eat here - because it‚Äôs 7 Stars ? Maybe so
column10: 000 Stars. This place is BAD. Real bad.'

author: Esteven Santiago
text: "Worst experience ever I ordered my pizza then it was a 30 min for delivery. Then I waited call again ask about my pizza . The guy at the phone said that he called and no one answered. Which my phone ever rung. The pizza was in his car on his phone and said that no one was there. I was waiting in the rain wet for it. He sent the driver again and saw he asked him delivery he said yeah . I saw you before and you saw me here waiting why didn't you ask me if I ordered pizza. Then he had the gut to say I was calling you. Took my pizza and paid him. Never again will order from this place. Plus my pizza was cold .worst place to order."
